# CLError.Code.deferredDistanceFiltered

**Case**

A constant that indicates deferred mode doesn’t support distance filters.

## Declaration

```swift
case deferredDistanceFiltered
```

## Discussion

Set the distance filter to [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/kCLDistanceFilterNone].

## Getting deferred location update errors

- **CLError.Code.deferredFailed**: A constant that indicates the location manager didn’t enter deferred mode for an unknown reason.
- **CLError.Code.deferredCanceled**: A constant that indicates your app or the location manager canceled the request for deferred updates.
- **CLError.Code.deferredAccuracyTooLow**: A constant that indicates deferred mode isn’t supported for the requested accuracy.
- **CLError.Code.deferredNotUpdatingLocation**: A constant that indicates the location manager didn’t enter deferred mode because location updates were already disabled or paused.
